column4: that was horribly overgeneralizing. i know lots of gay muslims.

the ubuntu live cd (and all ubuntu derivative livecds) fail to boot due to a fault expanding the squashfs. the iso files are not the culprit, and i have tried many times, it is not my burner. I tested this with a program called unetbootin, which adds a livecd to the hard drive and adds a grub option. when booted from the harddrive the cd boots without fault. can somebody please help me figure this out?
by the way I was kidding also :> bad taste
